title: Expression
description: Multi-purpose expression mini-language used to declare dynamic behaviour in Altinn 3 apps
examples: This will be the value if the condition above is true
This will be the value if the first condition is false, and the second is true
This will be the value if all the conditions above are false
Are you sure you want to delete

anyOf.description: Numbers can be cast to strings
Booleans can be cast to strings
Stringy true/false/0/1 can be cast to boolean
Numeric 0/1 can be cast to boolean
Numeric strings can be cast to numbers

func-if.title: If/else conditional expression
func-if.description: This function will evaluate and return the result of either branch. If else is not given, null will be returned instead.

func-component.title: Component value lookup function
func-component.description: This function will look up a nearby component and its value (only supports simpleBinding currently). Other components can be siblings, or siblings of parent groups.

func-dataModel.title: Data model lookup function
func-dataModel.description: This function will look up a value in the data model, using the JSON dot notation for referencing the data model structure. Relative positioning inside repeating groups will be resolved automatically if no positional indexes are specified.

func-externalApi.title: External API lookup function
func-externalApi.description: This function will look up a value from an external API defined in the app metadata. It uses JSON dot notation for referencing the API response structure.

func-displayValue.title: Component display value lookup function
func-displayValue.description: This function will look up a nearby component and return its display value. Other components can be siblings, or siblings of parent groups.

func-instanceContext.title: Instance context lookup function
func-instanceContext.description: This function can be used to lookup a value from the instance context

func-authContext.title: Auth context lookup function
func-authContext.description: This function can be used to check the users permissions on the current process step.

func-frontendSettings.title: Frontend settings lookup function
func-frontendSettings.description: This function can be used to lookup a value from frontendSettings (only supports scalar values, no objects or arrays)

func-concat.title: String concatenation function
func-concat.description: This function will concatenate strings or numbers, producing a final string as a result

func-equals.title: Equals function
func-equals.description: This function compares two values (or expressions) for equality

func-notEquals.title: Not equals function
func-notEquals.description: This function compares two values (or expressions) for inequality

func-not.title: Not function
func-not.description: This function inverts a boolean, returning true if given false, and vice versa.

func-greaterThan.title: Greater than function
func-greaterThan.description: This function compares two values (or expressions), returning true if the first argument is greater than the second

func-greaterThanEq.title: Greater than or equals function
func-greaterThanEq.description: This function compares two values (or expressions), returning true if the first argument is greater than or equals the second

func-lessThan.title: Less than function
func-lessThan.description: This function compares two values (or expressions), returning true if the first argument is less than the second

func-lessThanEq.title: Less than or equals function
func-lessThanEq.description: This function compares two values (or expressions), returning true if the first argument is less than or equals the second

func-and.title: And combinator
func-and.description: This function returns true if all the arguments (or expressions) are true

func-or.title: Or combinator
func-or.description: This function returns true if any of the arguments (or expressions) are true

func-formatDate.title: Format date function
func-formatDate.description: This function formats a string in ISO date format to a human readable format. Uses the language settings to determine the date format, but a custom format can also be specified

func-linkToComponent.title: Link to component function
func-linkToComponent.description: This function returns a link to a specific component in a form

func-linkToPage.title: Link to page function
func-linkToPage.description: This function returns a link to a specific page in a form

func-round.title: Round function
func-round.description: This function rounds a number to the nearest integer, or to the specified number of decimals

func-text.title: Text function
func-text.description: This function retrieves the value of a text resource key, or returns the key if no text resource is found

func-language.title: Language function
func-language.description: This function retrieves the current language (usually 'nb', 'nn' or 'en')

func-contains.title: Contains function
func-contains.description: This function checks if the first string contains the second string

func-notContains.title: Not contains function
func-notContains.description: This function checks if the first string does not contain the second string

func-startsWith.title: Starts with function
func-startsWith.description: This function checks if the first string starts with the second string

func-endsWith.title: Ends with function
func-endsWith.description: This function checks if the first string ends with the second string

func-stringLength.title: String length function
func-stringLength.description: This function returns the length of a string

func-commaContains.title: Comma contains function
func-commaContains.description: This function checks if the first comma-separated string contains the second string

func-lowerCase.title: Lower case function
func-lowerCase.description: This function converts a string to lower case

func-upperCase.title: Upper case function
func-upperCase.description: This function converts a string to upper case

func-_experimentalSelectAndMap.title: Experimental Select and map function
func-_experimentalSelectAndMap.description: This function takes a data model path which points to an array in the data model, and selects a specific property from the object in the containing array. It then concatenates the selected values into a single string separated by a space. The values can be prepended and appended with a string constant. This function is experimental and will be removed in future versions. Do not use unless you know what you're doing.

func-argv.title: Positional argument function
func-argv.description: This function returns the value of the positional argument at the specified index passed to the expression (currently only available for validation conditions)
